channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IA

item.title: Report E-2024020601
item.description:
Report E-2024020601

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-28
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XDM experienced a UN2783 SmartChoice HC release from a 50-pound poly jerrican. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5 pounds of product released to a 5’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor due to a puncture. The damaged container and released product were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. All impacted PPE was containerized into a second 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024021443
item.description:
Report X-2024021443

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-16
  • City: CEDAR RAPIDS
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Trailer was opened and steel drum was wet on top of pail. Liquid was leaking from cap. Item put in plastic lined hazmat tote to be processed. DescribePack: The seal on the cap of the steel drum is bad and allowed leakage of product. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Item was placed in plastic lined tote to prevent leakage from getting on other items.

item.title: Report X-2024020938
item.description:
Report X-2024020938

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-28T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-03
  • City: FORT DODGE
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found while unloading trailer Package handlers noticed box was a hazmat package and was visibly wet and package handler stopped the sort and notified manager DescribePack: Box had other Items stacked on top of it causing the lid to become damaged and leak onto box below DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Stopped the line evacuated trailer while Manager on duty got PPE and removed leaking package and other damaged package from trailer in a hazmat tote for proper cleanup
